title: AI Course Planning Agent — 1st Place (Lovable Track, Keywords AI Hackathon)
summary: An inspectable course-planning agent that turns degree rules into a usable plan with clear tradeoffs and manual control.
problem: Students struggle to turn degree requirements into a realistic semester plan. Existing tools are rigid and hide tradeoffs, so planning feels risky and slow.
approach: Designed a human-in-the-loop planner that explains its choices, surfaces conflicts early, and lets students edit constraints without breaking the plan.
impact: Won 1st Place (Lovable Track, Keywords AI Hackathon). Improved planning clarity with inspectable rationale and overrides.

caseStudy.problem: Students need a plan that fits degree rules, prerequisites, and real-life constraints. Most planners hide reasoning, so users can’t tell why a course was chosen or how to fix conflicts.
whatIBuilt: A multi-agent planner that assembles schedules from degree rules, prerequisites, and preferences.
A constraint editor for credits, time blocks, and must-take courses with instant validation.
An inspectable plan view that shows step-by-step rationale and alternatives.
uxDecisions: Inspectable agent state and evidence for each scheduling decision.
Manual overrides for conflicts, credit load, and time blocks without breaking the plan.
Calm UI with low-noise layout, clear hierarchy, and progressive disclosure.

systemDesign.note: Reasoning and constraints stay visible throughout, so users can trust and adjust the plan.

outcomes: Reduced planning back-and-forth by making tradeoffs explicit.

title: Multi-Agent Research Assistant for Explainable AI
summary: A research assistant that gathers sources, checks claims, and produces an explainable brief with an evidence trail.
problem: Explainable AI research is fragmented and hard to trust. Existing tools summarize without showing evidence, which slows decisions and increases rework.
approach: Built a multi-agent workflow that retrieves sources, critiques drafts, and surfaces evidence so users can audit and refine the output.
impact: Faster synthesis with an explicit evidence trail and clear points for human review.

caseStudy.problem: Researchers and practitioners need quick, trustworthy overviews of XAI topics. Summaries without evidence slow adoption and make it hard to verify claims.
whatIBuilt: A multi-agent pipeline for retrieval, synthesis, critique, and evidence checking.
A citation panel that links each claim to a source snippet and confidence.
A brief generator with exportable notes and a decision log.
uxDecisions: Inspectable chain-of-thought summaries without hiding evidence.
Manual overrides to re-rank sources, edit claims, and re-run sections.
Calm UI with a focused reading pane and minimal chrome.

systemDesign.note: Each stage writes to an evidence log so users can audit and edit before final export.

outcomes: Clearer, auditable summaries with a visible evidence trail.

title: AI-Powered Incident Logging Tool for Autism Support
summary: Voice-to-text capture, auto-summaries, and smart tagging to streamline classroom incident documentation and improve teacher–parent communication.
problem: Teachers in autism support classrooms spend excessive time on incident documentation, leading to inconsistent reporting and delayed parent communication.
approach: Developed an AI-powered tool that captures voice input, automatically generates summaries, and applies smart tagging for efficient incident tracking and reporting.
impact: Faster, standardized incident logs with clearer trend reporting for interventions and improved teacher-parent communication.

title: Operational Risk KPI Dashboard – Data Analytics
summary: Power BI dashboard visualizing 50+ synthetic risk incidents by department, root cause, severity; enables leadership risk reviews.
problem: Leadership lacked visibility into operational risk patterns across departments, making it difficult to prioritize mitigation efforts.
approach: Created a comprehensive Power BI dashboard that categorizes and visualizes risk incidents by department, root cause, and severity levels.
impact: Clear visibility into risk hotspots enabling accelerated mitigation planning and data-driven risk management decisions.

title: Predictive Sensor Framework – Zipcar Quality Control
summary: Team project designing a proactive sensor-driven predictive maintenance framework to reduce downtime and quality issues.
problem: Zipcar vehicles experienced unexpected downtime and quality issues due to reactive maintenance approaches.
approach: Designed a comprehensive predictive maintenance framework using sensor data and machine learning to anticipate maintenance needs.
impact: Proposed shift from reactive to proactive quality control with detailed roadmap and proof-of-concept implementation.

title: Celestial Analytics – Meteorite Landings
summary: Cleaned meteorite datasets (Python/pandas) and built Power BI visuals for mass, region, composition trends; anomaly detection & clustering.
problem: Meteorite landing data was messy and unstructured, making it difficult to identify patterns and anomalies in celestial events.
approach: Cleaned and processed meteorite datasets using Python/pandas, then created Power BI visualizations to identify trends and anomalies.
impact: Faster data exploration with surfaced outliers and geographic patterns, enabling better understanding of meteorite distribution.

title: Baseball Data Visualization & Analytics – Exploratory BI
summary: Built interactive visualizations to explore player metrics and trends for non-technical stakeholders.
problem: Baseball team management needed accessible insights from complex player performance data for decision-making.
approach: Created interactive visualizations using Python and Power BI to make player metrics and trends accessible to non-technical stakeholders.
impact: Clearer insights for non-technical stakeholders enabling data-driven player management decisions.

title: Leveraging AI for Equitable Urban Planning in Informal Settlements
summary: Research-style analytics to inform equitable planning scenarios for informal settlements using AI-driven insights.
problem: Urban planning in informal settlements lacked data-driven approaches to ensure equitable development and resource allocation.
approach: Conducted comprehensive research using AI and analytics to develop frameworks for equitable urban planning scenarios.
impact: Structured framework for city-scale 'what-if' questions enabling more equitable urban development planning.

title: HummCare Market Research & Case Study
summary: Market & competitive analysis; business model enhancements; stakeholder-ready deliverables.
problem: HummCare needed comprehensive market analysis and competitive positioning to refine their business model.
approach: Conducted thorough market and competitive analysis, then developed business model enhancements with stakeholder-ready deliverables.
impact: Enhanced business model with clear competitive positioning and stakeholder-ready strategic recommendations.
